        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends before deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park before going to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.

        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has a preference for The Red Lion, valuing a good atmosphere and large screen for the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.

          Answer: The Red Lion

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would go to The Red Lion, regardless of where his friends decide to go.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. While they are open to different pubs, they have a preference for The Red Lion.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion, or he could go to a different pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head

      Name

    • The King's Head

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who sometimes deflects blame and avoids responsibility.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys watching football with friends, particularly in a familiar and comfortable environment like his preferred pub, The King's Head. He values companionship and a good atmosphere while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely head straight to The King's Head, hoping to secure a good spot and enjoy the game in his preferred environment, regardless of whether his friends are there or not.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head.         Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football. He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football. He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to The King's Head alone.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.
          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football. He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to The King's Head alone.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head

  • Alice Lewis
      Name

      Action attempt
    • The King's Head

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introvert who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the football game and who to invite.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introvert who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the football game and who to invite.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
        Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would go to The Red Lion, regardless of where his friends decide to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a social gathering with friends at a market.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to subtly steer the conversation towards the game and suggest going to The Red Lion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a social gathering with friends at a market.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to subtly steer the conversation towards the game and suggest going to The Red Lion.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introvert who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding on plans for the evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.

          State
