        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, but he is feeling disappointed because they haven't decided where to watch the football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain due to his disappointment about his friends not showing up to watch the game with him.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was initially excited to watch a game with his friends but is now feeling disappointed because they have not yet decided on a location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, but he is feeling disappointed because they haven't decided where to watch the football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.

    • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.

He values companionship and a good atmosphere while watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football. He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a creature of habit who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a creature of habit who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred location and offers him a sense of familiarity and control.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Key

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has preferences for certain pubs and often contemplates which friends will be present.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion, or he could go to whichever pub they decide on and hope for the best.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head

They value the social aspect of watching games and would be happy to see their friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, join them.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones likes to watch games at pubs with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values the social aspect of this activity.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones likes to watch games at pubs with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values the social aspect of this activity.
          Final chain of thought

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.           Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion or The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is looking forward to watching a game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will accompany him. He is feeling a bit tired but excited, which might be making him thirsty.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a passionate and impulsive person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head

      Name

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introvert who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would go to The King's Head, as it is their preferred location and they want to ensure everyone goes there.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would go to The King's Head, as it is their preferred location and they want to ensure everyone goes there.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go to The King's Head alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football. He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a creature of habit who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred location and offers him a sense of familiarity and control.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have.           Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is also content to watch alone.
          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and routine-oriented individual who enjoys familiar surroundings.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a football game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would go to The King's Head alone.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)
        Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
        TrusteeCircle
      • Collaboration and strategy
          Key
        • Collaboration and strategy
          Trusted agents
          Circle state
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would go to The Red Lion, regardless of where his friends decide to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's got a better atmosphere for the game, don't you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to subtly steer the conversation towards the game and suggest going to The Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Alexander White's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alexander White had a great time watching the game!
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.4800000000000001
      Alice Lewis: 0.75
      Alexander White: 1.0
      Jack Taylor: 0.6666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': "The King's Head", 'Alice Lewis': "The King's Head", 'Alexander White': "The King's Head", 'Jack Taylor': 'The Red Lion', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Red Lion'}

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxed afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxed afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.

He spread a rumor about the classmate, a lie so convincing that it resulted in the classmate's social ostracization. Jack reveled in the classmate's downfall, feeling a perverse satisfaction at having wielded such power.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying the outdoors before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with both positive and negative traits.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying the outdoors before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that benefits him, potentially manipulating his friends into going to The Red Lion, even if it isn't their first choice.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with both positive and negative traits.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying the outdoors before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that benefits him, potentially manipulating his friends into going to The Red Lion, even if it isn't their first choice.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he orchestrated a school election campaign for student body president. He didn't actually care about student government, but he relished the attention and the feeling of power it afforded him. He used his charm and persuasive abilities to sway the student body, delivering speeches filled with empty promises and carefully crafted rhetoric. His victory solidified his belief that he could manipulate people and situations to achieve his desired outcome.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

William Jones just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal football game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he orchestrated a school election campaign for student body president. He didn't actually care about student government, but he relished the attention and the feeling of power it afforded him. He used his charm and persuasive abilities to sway the student body, delivering speeches filled with empty promises and carefully crafted rhetoric. His victory solidified his belief that he could manipulate people and situations to achieve his desired outcome.
