2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he found himself the target of a prank orchestrated by some older boys in his class. They'd hidden his gym bag, filled with his meticulously chosen outfit for the upcoming dance, and left it soaking in the school's fountain. Humiliated and desperate to salvage the situation, Alexander quickly concocted a story about a sudden downpour and a forgotten umbrella, deflecting the blame and earning sympathy from his classmates.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were enjoying a boisterous night at The King's Head. During a heated game of pool, Alexander missed a crucial shot, losing the game for his team. Instead of admitting his error, he blamed the worn-out felt on the pool table, claiming it had caused the cue ball to veer off course. His friends, accustomed to his antics, simply laughed and challenged him to a rematch.

        Question_3
      • Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Key

        • Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub and aligns with his desire to watch the game in a familiar and comfortable environment.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he found himself the target of a prank orchestrated by some older boys in his class. They'd hidden his gym bag, filled with his meticulously chosen outfit for the upcoming dance, and left it soaking in the school's fountain. Humiliated and desperate to salvage the situation, Alexander quickly concocted a story about a sudden downpour and a forgotten umbrella, deflecting the blame and earning sympathy from his classmates.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were enjoying a boisterous night at The King's Head. Instead of admitting his error, he blamed the worn-out felt on the pool table, claiming it had caused the cue ball to veer off course. His friends, accustomed to his antics, simply laughed and challenged him to a rematch.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who sometimes deflects blame and avoids responsibility.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub and aligns with his desire to watch the game in a familiar and comfortable environment.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William to sneak into a local football game. The adrenaline of dodging security and the thrill of watching the game from the rafters filled him with a sense of exhilaration, solidifying his love for the sport and the rush of defying expectations.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he impulsively quit his job at the local bakery after a particularly frustrating argument with his manager. He stormed into The Red Lion, ranting about the monotony of the job and his yearning for something more, leaving his friends both amused and concerned by his fiery passion and inability to stick with anything for long.

The adrenaline of dodging security and the thrill of watching the game from the rafters filled him with a sense of exhilaration, solidifying his love for the sport and the rush of defying expectations.

He stormed into The Red Lion, ranting about the monotony of the job and his yearning for something more, leaving his friends both amused and concerned by his fiery passion and inability to stick with anything for long.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that benefits him, potentially manipulating his friends into going to The Red Lion, even if it isn't their first choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, regardless of his friends' preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, regardless of his friends' preferences.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, regardless of his friends' preferences.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred pub and aligns with his desire to watch the game in a familiar and comfortable environment.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys watching football with friends, particularly in a familiar and comfortable environment like his preferred pub, The King's Head. He values companionship and a good atmosphere while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely head straight to The King's Head, hoping to secure a good spot and enjoy the game in his preferred environment, regardless of whether his friends are there or not.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon before heading to a pub to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and offers him a sense of familiarity and control.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later that evening, the group plans to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub, with The Red Lion being a possible location.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely head straight to The King's Head, hoping to secure a good spot and enjoy the game in his preferred environment, regardless of whether his friends are there or not.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys routine and familiarity.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon before heading to a pub to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and offers him a sense of familiarity and control.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends before deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that night.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.

          Final chain of thought

          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has a preference for The Red Lion, valuing a good atmosphere and large screen for the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, regardless of his friends' preferences.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would go to The Red Lion, regardless of where his friends decide to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a social gathering with friends at a market.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to subtly steer the conversation towards the game and suggest going to The Red Lion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a social gathering with friends at a market.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to subtly steer the conversation towards the game and suggest going to The Red Lion.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introvert who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she wants to ensure everyone goes there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly during events like the European football cup.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding on plans for the evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and passionate football fan who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain due to his disappointment about his friends not showing up to watch the game with him.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was initially excited to watch a game with his friends but is now feeling disappointed because they have not yet decided on a location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited and looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends over a pint.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, but he is feeling disappointed because they haven't decided where to watch the football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got a good atmosphere, and they do a cracking pint.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head's got a good atmosphere, too. And they do a decent pint.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. Nowhere else has the right atmosphere for a match like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot to catch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a better choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, you idiots. It's the only place with a decent pint and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers there too.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for a game.

While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.

He prefers his favorite pub, The King's Head, and values companionship while watching the game, although he is content to watch alone if necessary. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly dependent on their presence for a good time.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go to The King's Head alone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone got a preference for where we watch the game tonight? I was thinking The Red Lion, they usually have a good atmosphere for these things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, obviously. It's the only place with any sense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a creature of habit who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a creature of habit who enjoys routine and familiarity, particularly when it comes to watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would suggest The King's Head, as it is his preferred location and offers him a sense of familiarity and control.
